Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 737 Filed 07/22/22 Page 50 of 101
M6SQmax1
the table is more than 5, as 5 levels. And, thus, the total number would be 36.
THE COURT: I presume you agree with that, Mr. Everdell?
MR. EVERDELL: Yes, your Honor.
THE COURT: Under the 2003 manual -- I see. The highest total offense level, increase by 4 from 32 to 36.
MS. MOE: Yes, your Honor. Thank you.
THE COURT: Thank you, Ms. Moe. And that produces a guideline range 188 to 235.
MS. MOE: Yes, your Honor.
MR. EVERDELL: We agree with that, your Honor.
THE COURT: Thank you. Same question to you, Mr. Everdell. Preserving your objections, of course, but anything new based on what I said?
MR. EVERDELL: Yes, your Honor. I don't think because the government's response was the one added their request to add Virginia and Melissa as separate groups, so we do object to that. I know the Court has already ruled on that. We don't think the record is adequate to make them separate offense groups. I understand the Court has already ruled on that, but we would like to preserve that objection.
THE COURT: Understood. Thank you.
Do you want to respond, Ms. Moe?
MS. MOE: Your Honor, I think the Court's rulings
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00011569
